run id.short_description: yaml file that specifies error codes for files
run id.long_description: Explanation of all files which are expected to be empty due to a failed/missing module.

run id.short_description: somatic variants: vcf file of somatic variants
run id.long_description:
VCF file of somatic variants using one of the following the Sentieon somatic callers {tnscope (default), tnhaplotyper2, tnsnv}.

TNscope algorithm- https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#tnscope-algorithm
TNhaplotyper2- https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#tnhaplotyper2-algorithm
TNsnv - https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#tnsnv-algorithm

run id.short_description: somatic variants: maf file of somatic variants
run id.long_description: MAF file of VEP annotated variants using vcf2maf tool (https://github.com/mskcc/vcf2maf).  The vep annotated vcf (output.vcf.gz) file was used as the input for vcf2maf.

run id.short_description: somatic variants: vcf file of filtered somatic variants
run id.long_description: VCF file of filtered somatic variants.  With the output.vcf file as input, the vcftools software was used with parameter --remove-filtered-all to remove any variants whose FILTER column is anything other than PASS.  see http://vcftools.sourceforge.net/man_latest.html

run id.short_description: somatic variants: maf file of filtered somatic variants
run id.long_description: MAF file of VEP annotated filtered variants using vcf2maf tool (https://github.com/mskcc/vcf2maf).  The filtered vep annotated vcf file (filter.vep.vcf) file was used as input for vcf2maf.

run id.short_description: somatic variants: vcf file of filtered somatic variants from center target regions
run id.long_description: VCF file of filtered somatic variants from center target regions using bcftools (http://samtools.github.io/bcftools/bcftools.html).

run id.short_description: somatic variants: overlap of somatic and germline variants
run id.long_description: VCFtool's vcf-compare (http://vcftools.sourceforge.net/perl_module.html#vcf-compare) is used to compare somatic and germline variants.  The file shows the number of common variants, somatic only, and germline only variants.

run id.short_description: somatic variants: report file of tumor mutational burden in tumor and normal
run id.long_description: This file derived from the somatic and germline variants comparison results generated by vcf-compare (http://vcftools.sourceforge.net/perl_module.html#vcf-compare) and is formatted to be human readable.  The file reports the number of somatic/tumor only variants, germline/normal only variants, the number of shared variants, and the percent overlap (using the total number of somatic variants as the denominator).

run id.short_description: hla: report file of combined MHC class I and II results
run id.long_description: This file reports the MHC class I and II results.  The class I alleles are derived from the OptiType results and the class II alleles come from the xHLA results.

run id.short_description: neaontigen: list of predicted neoantigens
run id.long_description: The combined MHC class I and II predicted neoantigens using the pVACseq software.  The column definitions are given here (ref: https://pvactools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pvacseq/output_files.html)

run id.short_description: tumor purity: tumor purity analysis results
run id.long_description: Tumor purity calculations using the FACETS software (https://github.com/mskcc/facets)..

run id.short_description: tumor clonality: PyClone input file generated by sequenza library (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/sequenza/index.html)
run id.long_description: Input file generated for PyClone analysis.  Sequenza was used to generate the expected file format (https://github.com/Roth-Lab/pyclone#input-format).

run id.short_description: tumor clonality: tumor clonality analysis results
run id.long_description: Tumor clonality results using PyClone software (https://github.com/Roth-Lab/pyclone)..

run id.short_description: copynumber: copynumber analysis results
run id.long_description: Copy number variation analysis results using Sentieon CNV algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/appnotes/cnv/)

run id.short_description: copynumber: copynumber analysis results
run id.long_description: Segmented copy number variation file using Sentieon CNV algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/appnotes/cnv/)

run id.short_description: msisensor2: microsatellite instability calculation
run id.long_description: Microsatellite instability calculation using msisensor2 (https://github.com/niu-lab/msisensor2)

run id.short_description: rna: Variants called from RNA-seq data
run id.long_description: RNA-seq variants called using the Sentieon RNA Variant Calling pipeline(https://support.sentieon.com/manual/RNA_call/rna/).  Sentieon's Haplotyper algorithm was used for the variant calling.

run id.short_description: rna: Shared RNA and WES variants that is used for neoantigen prediction when RNA-seq data is provided with the WES run
run id.long_description: Variants file representing the common variants between RNA (haplotyper.rna.vcf.gz) and WES data (filter.neoantigen.vep.vcf).

run id.short_description: wes report: wes summary html report
run id.long_description: This is a gzipped file of the report directory, which contains the report.html file.  After unzipping the file, the user can load report/report.html into any browser to view the WES Summary Report.  The report contains run information (i.e. wes software version used to run the analysis as well as the software version of the major tools) as well as summarizations of sample quality, copy number variation, somatic variants, and HLA-type/neoantigen predictions.

run id.short_description: wes pipeline version- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility
run id.long_description: wes pipeline version- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility

run id.short_description: wes pipeline config file- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility
run id.long_description: wes pipeline config file- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility

run id.short_description: wes pipeline metasheet file- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility
run id.long_description: wes pipeline metasheet file- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility

run id.short_description: wes sample json for cohort report generation-INTERNAL ONLY
run id.long_description: wes sample json for cohort report generation-INTERNAL ONLY

normal cimac id.short_description: alignment: bam file with deduplicated reads
normal cimac id.long_description: Aligned reads were sorted and marked duplicates were removed using the Sentieon Dedup tool (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#dedup-algorithm)

normal cimac id.short_description: alignment: bam index file for deduplicated bam
normal cimac id.long_description: Bam index file for deduplicated bam file generated by the Sentieon Dedup tool (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#dedup-algorithm)

normal cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I results (using OptiType)
normal cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class I alleles using the Optitype software (https://github.com/FRED-2/OptiType).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the Optitype prediction algorithm.

normal cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I and II results (using xhla)
normal cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class II and II results using the xHLA software(https://github.com/humanlongevity/HLA).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the xHLA prediction algorithm.

Genome wide coverage file generated using the Sentieon CoverageMetrics algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#coveragemetrics-algorithm) with a coverage threshold (cov_thresh) set to 50.

Targeted exome regions coverage file using the Sentieon CoverageMetrics algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#coveragemetrics-algorithm) with a coverage threshold (cov_thresh) set to 50.
Genome wide coverage summary file generated by the Sentieon CoverageMetrics algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#coveragemetrics-algorithm).

normal cimac id.short_description: germline: vcf of haplotype variants in targeted regions
normal cimac id.long_description: Haplotype variants within targeted capture regions using Sentieon Haplotyper algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#haplotyper-algorithm)

tumor cimac id.short_description: alignment: bam file with deduplicated reads
tumor cimac id.long_description: Aligned reads were sorted and marked duplicates were removed using the Sentieon Dedup tool (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#dedup-algorithm)

tumor cimac id.short_description: alignment: bam index file for deduplicated bam
tumor cimac id.long_description: Bam index file for deduplicated bam file generated by the Sentieon Dedup tool (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#dedup-algorithm)

tumor cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I results (using OptiType)
tumor cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class I alleles using the Optitype software (https://github.com/FRED-2/OptiType).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the Optitype prediction algorithm.

tumor cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I and II results (using xhla)
tumor cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class II and II results using the xHLA software(https://github.com/humanlongevity/HLA).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the xHLA prediction algorithm.

Genome wide coverage file generated using the Sentieon CoverageMetrics algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#coveragemetrics-algorithm) with a coverage threshold (cov_thresh) set to 50.

Targeted exome regions coverage file using the Sentieon CoverageMetrics algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#coveragemetrics-algorithm) with a coverage threshold (cov_thresh) set to 50.
Genome wide coverage summary file generated by the Sentieon CoverageMetrics algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#coveragemetrics-algorithm).

tumor cimac id.short_description: germline: vcf of haplotype variants in targeted regions
tumor cimac id.long_description: Haplotype variants within targeted capture regions using Sentieon Haplotyper algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#haplotyper-algorithm)
